original_data.question: A 27-year-old gentleman is brought into the ED after being stabbed in the back by a knife. In addition to the pain from the wound, he complains of weakness in his left leg. Upon physical examination you find that he has no other visible injuries; however, he has 2/5 strength in the left lower extremity. Complete neurologic exam also finds a deficit in vibration sense and light touch on the left lower extremity as well as a loss of pain and temperature sensation in the right lower extremity. Which of the following lesions would result in the syndrome described?

model_response:
This patient has a presentation consistent with an anterior cord syndrome. This syndrome is characterized by loss of motor function, pain, and temperature sensation below the level of the lesion due to interruption of the anterior horns and the spinothalamic tract. Vibration and proprioception are typically spared because of their location in the dorsal columns. This patient has a stab wound to the back, which is a common mechanism for causing a cord syndrome. The other choices do not fit the clinical presentation.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: The inability in the male to have a PENILE ERECTION due to psychological or organ dysfunction.
A cutting device usually consisting of a sharpened blade attached to a handle.
An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli which are detected by NERVE ENDINGS of NOCICEPTIVE NEURONS.
bodily injury caused by physical means, with disruption of the normal continuity of structures.
A symptom or problem for which a patient seeks medical attention.
Clinical sign or symptom manifested as debility, or lack or loss of strength and energy.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle on the left side of the body.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Used with anatomic headings, animals, and sports for wounds and injuries. Excludes cell damage, for which "pathology" is used.
Degree of intensity or force in regard to a physical activity.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle on the left side of the body.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
The result of an examination or inquiry.
A lack or deficiency.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle on the left side of the body.
The measure of the level of heat of a human or animal.

The process in which specialized SENSORY RECEPTOR CELLS transduce peripheral stimuli (physical or chemical) into NERVE IMPULSES which are then transmitted to the various sensory centers in the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle on the right side of the body.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The result of an action.
A characteristic symptom complex.
